DataElement.preferredName: External Estimated Exposure Dose Assessment Method Marrow Space Performed Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the assessment method use to estimate external dose exposure for marrow spaces.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: External Estimate Exposure Dose Assessment Method Marrow Space Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface._To calculate approximately._The amount of exposure that a subject actually receives._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:The hollow space in long bones that contains bone marrow._Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method for estimating the dose of an external radiation exposure following whole- or partial- body exposure. Serial CBCs are obtained and the absolute lymphocyte count is calculated and tracked over time. The dose absorbed is correlated with the rate of decline of peripheral blood lymphocytes and the lowest value for absolute lymphocyte depletion.

Concepts.definition: A method for estimating the dose of an external radiation exposure following whole- or partial- body exposure. Serial CBCs are obtained and the absolute lymphocyte count is calculated and tracked over time. The dose absorbed is correlated with the rate of decline of peripheral blood lymphocytes and the lowest value for absolute lymphocyte depletion.
